schemes.scheme_name: 1. Indira Gandhi National Old Age Pension Scheme (IGNOAPS)

details.funding_by: The scheme is centrally sponsored and shared by Central and State Govt. on 50:50 basis. Financial Assistance is provided to old aged persons of 60  years age and above, living below poverty line (BPL)
details.application_process: The application forms are available with DSWO/TSWO free of cost. The applicant has to complete the application form and enclose proof regarding age, income, status and address. Complete case is to be submitted to the concerned Tehsil Social Welfare officer against proper receipt. The concerned Tehsil Social Welfare Officer (TSWO) consolidates the list of eligible applicants under the scheme and forwards it to the concerned District Social Welfare Officer for arrangement of funds and accord of sanction by a designated District level Sanctioning Committee headed by Director General, Social Welfare Department, Kashmir.

schemes.scheme_name: 2. Indira Gandhi National Widow Pension Scheme (IGNWPS)

details.funding_by: The scheme is centrally sponsored and shared by Centre and State Govt. on 50:50 basis.  Under the scheme widows in the age group of 40 to 79 years belonging to BPL category are eligible for monthly pension.
details.application_process: The application forms are available with DSWO/TSWO free of cost. The applicant has to complete the application form and enclose proof regarding age, income, status and address. Complete case is to be submitted to the concerned Tehsil Social Welfare officer against proper receipt. The concerned Tehsil Social Welfare Officer (TSWO) consolidates the list of eligible applicants under the scheme and forwards it to the concerned District Social Welfare Officer for arrangement of funds and accord of sanction by a designated District level Sanctioning Committee headed by Director General, Social Welfare Department, Kashmir.

schemes.scheme_name: 3. Indira Gandhi National Disability Pension Scheme (IGNDPS)
4. National Family Benefit Scheme (NFBS)

details.funding_by: National Family Benefit Scheme (NFBS) provides one-time lump sum cash assistance of Rs. 20,000 to families living below poverty line on the death of the primary bread-earner between the age group of 18-59. The objective of the scheme is to ensure social security of the households living below poverty line. The payment is to be made to the widow or the un-married daughter of the family.
details.application_process: The application forms are available with DSWO/TSWO free of cost. The applicant has to complete the application form and enclose proof regarding age, income, status, address and death certificate. Complete case is to be submitted to the concerned TSWO who consolidates the lists and forwards to Block Level Sanctioning Committee. The cases are then submitted to DSWO for accord of sanction by District level sanctioning committee headed by

eligibility_criteria.Age: 18-59 years whose primary bread earner dies due to accident/natural cause
eligibility_criteria.Remarks: One-time benefit from Centre Share only

schemes.scheme_name: 1. Old Age Pension (OAP),

details.funding_by: Old aged men and women with no source of income are provided financial support in the form of pension. Applicants shall be 60 years and above in case of males and 55 years or above in case of females and the applicant should have meager source of income.

schemes.scheme_name: 2.Widows/Women in Distress (WID),

details.funding_by: Women in distress, including destitute, separated, divorced or widow are provided financial support in the form of monthly pension. - The applicant should be aged between 40-79 years

schemes.scheme_name: 3. Pension for Physically Challenged Persons (PCP), , 4. Pension for, , Transgender Community

details.funding_by: The pension is provided to persons with 40% or more disability and having no source of income. Physically Challenged Person should be in the age of 18-79 years.

eligibility_criteria.Age: 18-79 years with severe or multiple disabilities

schemes.scheme_name: 1. Contributory Social Security Scheme (CSSS)

details.funding_by: With the aim to provide social security to the marginal workers having meager income the department has formulated this scheme to provide financial support on contributory basis. Marginal workers include Agricultural and Non-Agricultural Labourer, Rural Barber, Craftsman, Blacksmith, Shepherd, Masons, Weavers etc.

schemes.scheme_name: 2. Aam Aadmi Bima Yojana Scheme (AABYS), ,

details.funding_by: The scheme provides death and disability insurance cover to marginal sections in case the head of the family or one earning member of the household becomes disabled due to an accident or dies due to a natural/accidental cause.

schemes.scheme_name: 1. Post-matric Scholarship for Physically Challenged, SC & OBC Students,

details.Eligibility: For OBC and physically challenged students:- The income limit of parents/guardians should not exceed Rs. 1.00 lacs/year.In case of Physically Challenged, the disability should be 40% and above and should be studying in recognized institutions for professional/academic courses.- The student should not be receiving simultaneously any other scholarship from any other Institution for any other course under any other category.For Scheduled Caste/Pahari students:- The scholarship is available for students at post Matric or Post Graduation level.- Income limit of parents/guardians is Rs. 2.00 Lacs per year.- The students must be from SC/Pahari speaking category, and studying in recognized institutions for undergoing various professional/academic courses.- The student is not in receipt of any other scholarship under any other institution/course/category.

schemes.scheme_name: 1. Pre-matric Scholarship for Physically Challenged and Other Backward Classes Students (OBC)

details.funding_by: Pre-matric scholarship is provided to OBC and physically challenged students from class I to X.School attendance required for all classes is 80% and above,Minimum marks obtained should be 50% and above for class VI-VIII and 55% and above for class IX-X in previous exam qualified.For all classes the income of parents/guardians should not exceed Rs. 2100/- per month

schemes.scheme_name: 2. Stipend to ITI Trainees from OBC Background

details.funding_by: Students who are studying in Industrial Training Institute and whose parental income is low, receive a monthly stipend to support them in their academic course. Students who belong to OBC category and are pursuing various technical courses in the district in Industrial Training Institutes are eligible for the stipend under the scheme. The monthly income of the parents/guardians of the students shall not exceed Rs. 2100/- per month

schemes.scheme_name: 3. Pre-matric Scholarship for Children of those Engaged in Unclean Occupation
1. Pre-matric Scholarship to Students belonging to National Minorities
2. Post-matric Scholarship to students belonging to National Minorities
3. Merit-cum-Means based scholarship to students belonging to National Minorities
1. Dr. Ambedkar post-matric scholarship for Economically Backward Classes, (EBC) students
Dr. Ambedkar post-matric scholarship for Denotified Nomadic & Semi-, nomadic tribes(DNT) students
3. Central sector schemes of pre and post-matric scholarship for students with, disabilities
1. Financial assistance to Gadhanjis (Fishermen)
2. Grant of Prosthetic Aid for fitting-up/repairing of Artificial Limbs
3. Grant in Aid to NGO's

details.funding_by: The Department is providing grant-in-aid to registered voluntary organizations for various welfare schemes like income generations, running of homes for destitute/ orphans etc.
details.Eligibility: The organization should have registered under the Registrar of Societies Act, 1961.
details.application_process: Applications for grant-in-aid shall be submitted by the NGO/Institutions on the prescribed format (form-“A”) supported by the requisite document in the 1st quarter of each financial year but not latter than 30th June. The concerned Distt. Social Welfare Officers after have complete all the requisite formalities shall submit the grant-in-aid cases to the Director by or before the end of September. The Director Social Welfare shall submit the same to the Administrative Department by the end of November.

eligibility_criteria.The Department is providing grant-in-aid: The organization should have registered under the Registrar of Societies Act, 1961.The voluntary organization should have been registered for at least 3 years at the time of applying for grant under the scheme.It is non-sectarian, engaged in welfare services irrespective of caste, colour or creed.It has tangible assets, trained personal and adequate equipment.

schemes.scheme_name: 4. State Marriage Assistance Scheme

eligibility_criteria.funding_by: Norms for availing benefits under the scheme
eligibility_criteria.“State Marriage Assistance Scheme” (SMAS: The beneficiary girl:·   Should be an identified poor girl in the survey lists already available with the              concerned DDCs/District Social Welfare Officers.·    Should be above 18 years of age.·    Should not have availed the benefits for the same purpose under any other State/Centrally Sponsored Scheme.·    Can avail benefit only once under the scheme.          After determining the eligibility, as per the laid down guidelines, the Committee may sanction the financial assistance to the beneficiary, subject to the availability of funds. The amount of assistance “shall be credited to the saving bank accounts of the beneficiary.

schemes.scheme_name: 5. AASRA

eligibility_criteria.“Aasra” is a newly launched comprehensiv: ·             Application on the prescribed format·        All bread winners of families whose total annual income is less then Rs.75000/-·        All widows and destitute residing in the State.The life/accident cover will be paid only to the prescribed nominee in case of death of the beneficiary

schemes.scheme_name: 6. HUNAR

eligibility_criteria.funding_by: Norms for availing benefits under the scheme
eligibility_criteria.“Hunnar” is a module of skill Developmen: ·       Should be an identified poor girl in the survey lists already available with the concerned    DDCs  /        District   Social Welfare Offices.·        Should be above 18 years of age.·        Should not be school going girl.·        Should meet eligibility criteria of the respective scheme.          The scheme has to be an organic, with the following constituents:·       Skill Development.·       Micro-Enterprises.·       Co-operative societies for the production.·       Manufacturing of goods.·       Marketing of products.Implementing Agencies·       Directorate of Animal Husbandry·       Directorate of Handicrafts·       J&K State Women’s Development Corporation·       Rural Development Department·       Directorate of Handloom·       J&K Entrepreneurship Development Institute·       Cooperative DepartmentThe Social Welfare Department, J&K shall be the nodal department for implementation and monitoring of the scheme. The District Social Welfare Officers, with in  their respective jurisdictions shall distribute “Intend Forms” and also shall consolidate the list in order of preference of the trade and forward the same to the Social Welfare Board, who in turn will forward the list to the concerned Training Imparting agencies/department.
